content.description: A researcher is interested in the relationship between adverse childhood experiences (ACEs) and well-being as adults. She surveyed a group of 10 randomly selected adults about whether they had experienced adverse childhood experiences from a list. The participants were also asked to take a survey measuring their overall well-being. The data for the two surveys are presented in the table.
content.question: Participant ID Number of Adverse Childhood Experiences (ACEs) Score on the Well-Being Scale (higher scores indicate higher well-being) A 2 8 B 5 4 C 8 3 D 1 9 E 0 8 F 6 5 G 9 4 H 5 6 I 5 8 J 7 2 What is the mode of the number of adverse childhood experiences (ACEs) for this study?

skill.text: 3.B: Calculate and interpret measures of central tendency, variation, and percentile rank in a given data set.
